title: How can they tell how many people are listening to a specific radio station or TV program?
text:
There are several companies that analyze audience numbers and provide
them to radio and television stations. Usually, they survey markets by
selecting volunteers who agree to keep a diary of their listening and
viewing patterns. Some of those people also are given electronic
devices that attach to TV sets or pick up radio signals and relay the
data to the monitoring companies.



For television, the leading company is Nielson

http://en-us.nielsen.com/tab/industries/media



Arbitron does similar work with radio

http://www.arbitron.com/home/content.stm
